entries.title: Appointment Scheduled
entries.definition: The initial stage when a prospect has agreed to a discovery call or meeting. At this stage, the sales rep should prepare to understand the prospect's needs, challenges, and goals.

entries.title: Qualified to Buy
entries.definition:
The prospect has been vetted and confirmed to have:

  • Budget - Financial resources available
  • Authority - Decision-making power
  • Need - Genuine business problem to solve
  • Timeline - Urgency to implement

entries.title: Presentation Scheduled
entries.definition: A formal product demonstration or presentation has been scheduled. The sales rep will showcase how the solution addresses the prospect's specific needs and pain points.

entries.title: Decision Maker Bought-In
entries.definition: The key decision maker has expressed positive intent to move forward. This stage indicates strong buying signals and executive sponsorship of the deal.

entries.title: Contract Sent
entries.definition: A formal proposal, quote, or contract has been sent to the prospect for review. The deal is in the final stages before close, pending signature and approval.

entries.title: Closed Won
entries.definition:
The deal has been successfully closed. The prospect has signed the contract and committed to becoming a customer. This triggers:

  • Revenue recognition
  • Customer onboarding
  • Lifecycle stage update to Customer

entries.title: Closed Lost
entries.definition:
The deal will not close. Common reasons include:

  • Lost to competitor
  • Budget constraints
  • No decision made
  • Timing not right

Always capture the closed lost reason for future analysis.

entries.title: Deal Amount
entries.definition: The monetary value associated with a deal. This property is used to calculate pipeline value, forecast revenue, and track sales performance metrics.

entries.title: Close Date
entries.definition: The anticipated date when the deal is expected to close. This is crucial for forecasting and should be updated as the deal progresses through the pipeline.

entries.title: Deal Type
entries.definition:
Categorizes the nature of the deal. Common types include:

  • New Business - First-time customer
  • Existing Business - Expansion or upsell
  • Renewal - Contract renewal

entries.title: Priority
entries.definition: Indicates the relative importance or urgency of a deal. Typically categorized as High, Medium, or Low based on deal size, strategic value, or closing timeline.

entries.title: Forecast Category
entries.definition:
Classifies deals by likelihood to close for revenue forecasting:

  • Omit - Not in forecast
  • Pipeline - Early stage
  • Best Case - Good chance
  • Commit - High confidence
  • Closed - Won or lost
